---
title: "Linear models: a minimal example"
---

Fit and interpret a simple linear model.

```{r}
#| message: false
library(tidyverse)
set.seed(1)

dat <- tibble(
  x = seq(0, 10, length.out = 50),
  y = 2 + 0.8 * x + rnorm(50, sd = 1.5)
)

fit <- lm(y ~ x, data = dat)
broom::tidy(fit)
```


```{r}
# Visual check
library(ggplot2)

dat |>
  ggplot(aes(x, y)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = TRUE) +
  labs(title = "Linear fit", x = "x", y = "y") +
  theme_minimal()
```

```{r}
# Model summary and basic diagnostics
broom::glance(fit)
```
